page.title: 11INTERESTING PEOPLE OF KILK.
page.content: Mr Tamblyn retired at the begining of 1985.He was for many years the{village {policeman}for Kilkhampton.Burglary was the most common crime he had to deal with,especially at the height of the holiday season,July-August.Vandalism was somtimes a problem and Penstowe road was a blackspot for accidents.Mr Tamblyn's transport progressed from being all on foot, to a bicycle,then a motor-bike,a mini-van and finally a motor car. Ivor Potter used to live at the lodge on Penstowe estate where his father was a{butler.}Ivor is now a{British {Telecom engineer}and lives at "Penwenna".He has had this job for over 25 years and in his spare time has written several plays and produced them.In these plays the people of the district take part.
